edu.biu.scapi.interactiveMidProtocols.sigmaProtocol.damgardJurikKnowledge

Class SigmaDJKnowledgeProverComputation

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.biu.scapi.interactiveMidProtocols.sigmaProtocol.damgardJurikKnowledge.SigmaDJKnowledgeProverComputation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DJBasedSigma, SigmaProverComputation

    public class SigmaDJKnowledgeProverComputation
extends java.lang.Object
implements SigmaProverComputation, DJBasedSigma
    Concrete implementation of Sigma Protocol prover computation.

    This protocol is used for a party to prove knowledge of the plaintext and randomness of a Damg{\aa}rd-Jurik ciphertext.

    This protocol is due to Cramer, Damg{\aa}rd, and Nielsen, "Multiparty Computation from Threshold Homomorphic Encryption"

    Author:
    Eindhoven University of Technology (Meilof Veeningen)

      • computeFirstMsg

        public SigmaProtocolMsg computeFirstMsg(SigmaProverInput input)
        Computes the first message of the protocol.

        SAMPLE random values a <- ZN, u <- Z*n COMPUTE B=(1+n)^a u^N mod N'

        Specified by:
        computeFirstMsg in interface SigmaProverComputation
        Parameters:
        input - MUST be an instance of SigmaDJKnowledgeProverInput.
        Returns:
        the computed message
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if input is not an instance of SigmaDJProduct2ProverInput.

      • computeSecondMsg

        public SigmaProtocolMsg computeSecondMsg(byte[] challenge)
                                  throws CheatAttemptException
        Computes the second message of the protocol.

        "COMPUTE t=floor((a+cy)/N), d=a+cy mod N, e=u r^c (1+n)^t mod N'".

        Specified by:
        computeSecondMsg in interface SigmaProverComputation
        Parameters:
        challenge -
        Returns:
        the computed message.
        Throws:
        CheatAttemptException - if the received challenge's length is not equal to the soundness parameter.
